info.title: Cisco-IOS-XE-device-hardware-oper
info.description:
This module contains a collection of YANG definitions
     for Device Hardware operational data.
     Copyright (c) 2017-2020, 2022-2024 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.

Cisco IOS-XE operational state data (read-only).
**Category:** Other Services
**Paths:** 6

**YANG Model:** [Cisco-IOS-XE-device-hardware-oper.yang](https://github.com/YangModels/yang/blob/main/vendor/cisco/xe/17181/Cisco-IOS-XE-device-hardware-oper.yang)

**📊 YANG Tree:** [View Cisco-IOS-XE-device-hardware-oper structure](https://jeremycohoe.github.io/cisco-ios-xe-openapi-swagger/yang-trees/Cisco-IOS-XE-device-hardware-oper.html)

var-name.description: Name of the ROMMON environment variable

var-value.description: Definition of the ROMMON environment variable

cr.description:
The value of configuration register with which
         the processor module booted

cr-next.description:
The value of configuration register with which
         the processor module will boot at next reboot

cr-hex.description:
The hex value of configuration register with which
         the processor module booted

cr-next-hex.description:
The hex value of configuration register with which
         the processor module will boot at next reboot

physical-index.description: The SNMP physical index of this entity

status.description: The current status of the entity

description.description: The detailed description of this entity

status-last-change.description:
The timestamp when the entity transitioned into
         its reported status

cr.description:
The value of configuration register with which
         the processor module booted

cr-next.description:
The value of configuration register with which
         the processor module will boot at next reboot

cr-hex.description:
The hex value of configuration register with which
         the processor module booted

cr-next-hex.description:
The hex value of configuration register with which
         the processor module will boot at next reboot

cr-info.description: The configuration register values of device

hw-type.description: Type of the hardware being represented

hw-dev-index.description: The physical index of the inventory item

part-number.description:
The part number of this device. This
         is only valid if the device is a field replaceable
         unit

serial-number.description:
The serial number of the device. This is only
         valid if the device is individually trackable

field-replaceable.description: The device is field replaceable or not

alarm-instance.description:
The instance of this alarm. This corresponds to the
         entity index

alarm-category.description: The category (or severity) of the alarm that is being asserted

reload-severity.description: Indicates if reload is normal or abnormal

sw-ver.description: Software version running at the time of the reload

ha-role.description: High availability role of the reloaded FRU

crash-data-file.description: Full path to the crash data file generated during system crash

fru-type.description: FRU type of the device that experienced reload

fru-id.description: FRU identification of the device that experienced reload

current-time.description: Current time on device in UTC

boot-time.description:
This timestamp indicates the time that the system was last
         restarted.  The value is the timestamp in seconds relative
         to the Unix Epoch (Jan 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC).

unsaved-config.description:
Indicate whether the device configuration has changed,
         but has not been saved to non volatile RAM. This leaf
         mirrors the state used when IOS asks the user about
         config that has changed upon issuing a reload. As such,
         it might indicate that the configuration is dirty, when
         there are no actual changes.

reload-history-support.description:
Indicates if platform supports
         reload history feature or not

mac-address.description:
The MAC address of the device which represents
         MAC address of active module or chassis

cloud-id-supported.description: When present, the Cloud ID information is valid

cloud-id.description:
Cloud ID is the Meraki serial number programmed in the hardware security
         chip.  This is valid only if the device supports Cloud ID

reload-severity.description: Indicates if reload is normal or abnormal

sw-ver.description: Software version running at the time of the reload

ha-role.description: High availability role of the reloaded FRU

crash-data-file.description: Full path to the crash data file generated during system crash

fru-type.description: FRU type of the device that experienced reload

fru-id.description: FRU identification of the device that experienced reload

reload-history.description:
Reload History list, each element in the list
         represents one occurrence of a reload

sw-ver.description: Software version running at the time of the reload

ha-role.description: High availability role of the reloaded FRU
